result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: 3:34 PM Court called 22CF433 and 22CF426.   Defendant John Fredrick Brilliott in court in custody from Stanley Correctional Institution.  Prosecuting attorney Jonathan Ross in court for the State of Wisconsin. Discussion about counsel for defendant.  Per letter filed by Public Defender's office, they are unable to find an attorney to represent defendant at this time.  For case 22CF433 the State called Portage Police Officer Jesse Sprague; sworn.  Direct by ADA Jonathan Ross. No cross.  Witness excused.  Court found probable cause, bound over for further proceedings.  Information filed.  3:43 PM in case 22CF426 State called Portage Police Officer Jesse Sprague; sworn.  Direct by ADA Ross.  No cross. Witness excused.  Court found probable cause, bound over for further proceedings.  Information filed.  3:54 court in recess to allow filing of information.  4:01 back on record appearances the same.  For 22CF433 Information filed; waived reading.  Court entered not guilty pleas.  Final plea set for 10-20-2022 at 2:00 PM and Jury trial set for 10-31-2021 at 9:00 AM.   For 22CF426 information filed, waived reading; not guilty pleas entered.  Matter continued for scheduled jury trial in Br 2.  Adjourned at 4:10 PM
